Class TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility

  • public class TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility works with 2 dimensional ragged arrays with a maximum of 10 rows and 10 columns This utility works with negative and positive numbers
    Author:
    Rajashow

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double getAverage(double[][] dataSet)
      Returns the average of the elements in the two dimensional array
      static double getColumnTotal(double[][] sales, int col)
      Returns the total of the selected column in the two dimensional array index 0 refers to the first column.
      static double getHighestInArray(double[][] dataSet)
      Returns the Largest element in the two dimensional array
      static double getHighestInColumn(double[][] sales, int col)
      Returns the largest element of the selected column in the two dimensional array index 0 refers to the first row.
      static double getHighestInRow(double[][] dataSet, int row)
      Returns the largest element of the selected row in the two dimensional array index 0 refers to the first row.
      static double getLowestInArray(double[][] dataSet)
      Returns the smallest element in the two dimensional array
      static double getLowestInColumn(double[][] sales, int col)
      Returns the smallest element of the selected column in the two dimensional array index 0 refers to the first row.
      static double getLowestInRow(double[][] dataSet, int row)
      Returns the largest element of the selected row in the two dimensional array index 0 refers to the first row.
      static double getRowTotal(double[][] sales, int row)
      Returns the total of the selected row in the two dimensional array index 0 refers to the first row.
      static double getTotal(double[][] dataSet)
      Returns the total of all the elements of the two dimensional array
      static double[][] readFile(java.io.File file)
      Reads from a file and returns a ragged array of doubles The maximum rows is 10 and the maximum columns for each row is 10 Each row in the file is separated by a new line Each element in the row is separated by a space Suggestion: You need to know how many rows and how many columns there are for each row to create a ragged array.
      static void writeToFile(double[][] sales, java.io.File selectedFile)
      Writes the ragged array of doubles into the file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public static double[][] readFile(java.io.File file)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads from a file and returns a ragged array of doubles The maximum rows is 10 and the maximum columns for each row is 10 Each row in the file is separated by a new line Each element in the row is separated by a space Suggestion: You need to know how many rows and how many columns there are for each row to create a ragged array.
        Parameters:
        file - : File
        Returns:
        sales : double[][]
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
